definition: a round or roundish body or mass: such as

a spherical or ovoid body used in a game or sport                                      
             
             a tennis ball
earth, globe
a spherical or conical projectile
a roundish protuberant anatomical structure (as near the tip of a human finger or toe or at the base of a thumb)
testis

nonsense                                      
                
                  —often used interjectionally
nerve sense 3
a game in which a ball is thrown, kicked, or struck
a pitch not swung at by the batter that fails to pass through the strike zone

a hit or thrown ball in various games                                      
             
             foul ball

competent, knowledgeable, alert                                      
             
             the other introductory essay … is much more on the ball

of ability or competence                                      
             
             if the teacher has something on the ball, the pupils won't squirm much

to form or gather into a ball                                      
             
             balled the paper into a wad
to have sexual intercourse with
to form or gather into a ball
to engage in sexual intercourse

to play basketball                                      
             
             Common shot all his own scenes on the hardwood, balling against NBA superstars Dwyane Wade and Dwight Howard.
a large formal gathering for social dancing

a very pleasant experience : a good time                                      
             
             everyone had a ball at the wedding
John died 1381 English priest and social agitator
Lucille (Désirée) 1911–1989 American actress and comedienne
to form (something) into a ball

something round or roundish                                      
             
             a ball of yarn
a round or roundish object used in a game or sport
a game or sport (as baseball) played with a ball
a solid usually round shot for a gun

the rounded bulge at the base of the thumb or big toe                                      
             
             the ball of the foot
a pitched baseball that is not hit and is not a strike

to make or come together into a ball                                      
             
             He balled his fists.
a large formal party for dancing

a good time                                      
             
             I had a ball at the wedding.
a round or roundish body or mass: as
a roundish protuberant part of the body: as
the rounded eminence by which the base of the thumb is continuous with the palm of the hand
the rounded broad part of the sole of the human foot between toes and arch and on which the main weight of the body first rests in normal walking
the padded rounded underside of a human finger or toe near the tip
eyeball
a large pill (as one used in veterinary medicine) : bolus
to give a medicinal ball to (as a horse)

foul ball

definition: a round object used in games and sports
a round or nearly round object or shape
any game that you play with a ball, especially an informal game
an occasion when someone kicks, hits, or throws the ball in a game, or the way they kick, hit, or throw it
a formal social event at which there is dancing and usually a meal
the part of your foot, hand, or thumb that is slightly round and sticks out
the game is up; it’s all over
in: Try to kick the ball into the back of the net.
a tennis/golf ball
Shape the dough into balls.
a melon ball
ball of: a ball of wool
We’ll be outside playing ball until dinner.
He kicked a long ball upfield.
the college’s summer ball
ball of: He balanced on the balls of his feet.
the ball is in someone’s court
a ball of fire
get/set/start the ball rolling
have a ball
have/keep several balls in the air
on the ball
pick up the ball and run with it
play ball

definition: any object in the shape of a sphere, especially one used as a toy by children or in various sports such as tennis and football:
a long piece of thread that has been rolled into a ball:
the rounded part of your foot or thumb where the toes join the foot and the thumb joins the hand
a ball-shaped Christmas decoration for hanging on a tree
in football, a pass from one player to another:
in baseball, a ball that is thrown to the batter but that the batter does not try to hit because it is outside the hitting area
any game that involves throwing and catching a ball:
a large formal occasion where people dance:
a testicle:
to make something form a closed round shape:
(of a man) to have sex with someone
a round object that can roll and usually bounce and that is used in many games in which it is thrown, hit, or kicked:
The ball of the foot is the curved part where the big toe joins the foot.
a large, formal occasion where people dance
infml A ball is also any very enjoyable experience:
in: a beach/golf/tennis ball
Just try to concentrate on hitting the ball.
The kitten curled itself into a ball (= the shape of a ball).
a ball of string/wool
Long picked up a great ball from Campbell and rounded the keeper to score.
The kids were outside playing ball.
I like watching college/pro ball.
Did you go to the Summer Ball last year?
He noticed a lump in his left ball.
She balled her fists so her nails dug deep into her palms.
a golf/soccer/tennis ball
"How was your weekend?" "We had a ball!"
